body: This looks good.
Was issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MILAGRO-27 in Apache Jira (this issue will be closed presently)
Hi, yes it should. We're going to fix this.
Let's close issue.
@sebbASF - we've addressed this issue - please let me know if it's OK?

It's better, but still a bit hard to read.

The following phrase:

"the need for a PKI infrastructure as the main reason to issue certificates"

would read better as

"the need for a PKI infrastructure, since the main reason to issue certificates"

As it stands, the "as" clause is ambiguous.
It could be taken in the sense of "Using another system as a backup".
The word "since" does not have that double meaning, and the comma helps too.
Might be an idea to add a link to the Support page as well.
@sebbASF - this is now done - please can you confirm?
@sebbASF - I've updated the support page to include an "issues" section - please can you confirm this is OK, and I'll close this?

It would be nice if the user did not have to click so many times to get to the issue tracker.

Currently the route from the main page is:
- click "Support"
- read the Issues para, and click "Contributing"
- scan the "Issues" para and click the appropriate link
- click the Issues tab

Obviously it's not possible to have a one-click link, as there are several issue trackers, but some of the stages could be eliminated.

One can go straight to "Contributing" from the main page, but if I am looking to report a bug, I would normally expect to find the instructions under "Support" rather than "Contributing"

Might be nice to have direct link to issues section on front page
Also could link directly to issues tab on Contributing page.

Another possibility would be to have a separate Issue handling page.
This could be linked from Support, Contributing and the Home page.

That reads better, thanks.

Just notice that the first sentence says:

"Apache Milagro is core security infrastructure and crypto libraries"

I suspect that should be something like:

"Apache Milagro is a set of core security infrastructure and crypto libraries
This has been addressed in the crypto-c library's next release (2.0.0).  The JS library will be addressed in its next release.
Hi @sebbASF  - I've updated the support page with direct links to each repo's issue page
@sebbASF - done.  Please can you confirm and I'll close this issue?
Reads much better, thanks
Thanks, makes it easier to find the trackers
Thanks for the change and getting it merged. It still seems that the swagger ui on https://milagro.apache.org/ is still using old code and the problems that brings.
thanks @pjfanning, yes, I just realised this needs to be merged over to the `asfsite` branch in order for the release to be deployed. @kealan @smihaylov could you do this for me?
@pjfanning #39 should have fixed this, I tested and could no longer reproduce the bug. Can you confirm this?
Thanks @ruphy - that looks good now. ASF Infrastructure had removed access to the page yesterday but it is back now and seems XSS free.
Looks like these dependencies are up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

Looks like lodash is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like minimist is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Approved
Looks like set-value is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like json5 is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like decode-uri-component is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like json-schema is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like ws is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.
@sebbASF thank you, I'll make sure to insert it in the homepage!
Thanks - the disclaimer should be present on all pages, not just the homepage.
